p: Various reports have inferred the occurrence of interepidemic circulation of RVFV on the basis of seropositivity in the absence of reported outbreaks or vaccination, in livestock [ 17, 27, 28] wildlife [ 29, 30] and humans [ 31, 32]. Two recent studies have reported longitudinal follow-up of sentinel sheep and goats in Kenya, reporting low rates of seroconversion in areas that had previously experienced outbreaks [ 33, 34]. However, no published studies have attempted to quantify the rate of seroconversion in livestock by follow-up of seronegative animals in a region where outbreaks have never been reported.
